weather_report:
Midday in Perth feels clean and unhurried, the sky stretched taut and blue with hard-edged shadows underfoot. The sun has a confident shine to it now; UV is strong at this hour and will stay assertive into early afternoon before softening later. Forecasts show the afternoon holding clear and vivid, the kind of day where the horizon looks freshly sketched and distant buildings appear cut from paper.

Expect a bright, dry feel through late afternoon with little to trouble the view, and a gentler warmth toward the drive home. Dress light and breathable, add sunglasses and a brimmed hat, and give your skin a shield of sunscreen. It’s a good day for mundane pleasures done unrushed: a shaded café lunch, a quick trundle through errands while the shops are quiet, hanging the washing where it will crisp nicely, or a slow lap along the river paths once the edge comes off the sun. Garden tasks and dog walks will feel kinder later; until then, keep water close and take the long way in the shade.
